dt: {bc}any of various chiefly marine birds (subfamily Sterninae of the family Laridae and especially genus {it}Sterna{/it}) that differ from the related gulls in usually smaller size, a more slender build, a sharply pointed bill, narrower wings, and an often forked tail

et: of Scandinavian origin; akin to Danish {it}terne{/it} tern
shortdef: any of various chiefly marine birds (subfamily Sterninae of the family Laridae and especially genus Sterna) that differ from the related gulls in usually smaller size, a more slender build, a sharply pointed bill, narrower wings, and an often forked tail

dt: {bc}a Holarctic tern ({it}Sterna paradisaea{/it}) that breeds in arctic regions and migrates to southern Africa and South America

shortdef: a Holarctic tern (Sterna paradisaea) that breeds in arctic regions and migrates to southern Africa and South America

dt: {bc}a very small black-capped tern ({it}Sterna antillarum{/it}) with a white body and forehead that is found chiefly in coastal areas of eastern North America and California

shortdef: a very small black-capped tern (Sterna antillarum) with a white body and forehead that is found chiefly in coastal areas of eastern North America and California

dt: {bc}a medium-sized tern ({it}Sterna dougallii{/it}) that is widespread at sea and in coastal areas of the Atlantic, Pacific, and Indian oceans and that has a faint roseate tinge to the breast in the breeding season

shortdef: a medium-sized tern (Sterna dougallii) that is widespread at sea and in coastal areas of the Atlantic, Pacific, and Indian oceans and that has a faint roseate tinge to the breast in the breeding season

dt: {bc}a widely distributed tern ({it}Sterna fuscata{/it}) of tropical oceans that is blackish above and white below

shortdef: a widely distributed tern (Sterna fuscata) of tropical oceans that is blackish above and white below —called also wideawake
